subject: Re: [junit] RE: Is there a tool which generates JUnit-teststubs?
msgSnippet: ... I think it s important to understand the value of test coverage as perceived by the person requesting those tests.  In other words, if you had
messageBody:
"J. B. Rainsberger" wrote:

> "If I didn't spend 80 hours writing these tests, I could spend my time
> writing each test as I need it and the rest of the time writing new
> code. Given what I know about the code, I won't be any faster writing
> tests whether I write them all at once or as I need them. With that in
> mind, what would you like me to do? In the worst case, I need all the
> tests up front and end up writing them now anyway. It looks like you
> win." How does that sound, everyone?

I think it's important to understand the value of test coverage as
perceived by the person requesting those tests. In other words, if you
had automatically-generated tests for all the code, how might that help
you?

Mike

--
Mike Clark
Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
